p: As:IS:UAS:DAS ratios can fluctuate in space and time; for instance, as a result of serotype differences in virulence [ 7, 23]. The contribution of inapparent (As+IS) infections across the spectrum of As:IS:AS ratios is driven by the ratio of As to IS infections, with the total contribution of As+IS infections generally being similar to their numerical prominence in the infected population ( Fig 6). Although variability in As:IS:AS ratios likely does drive some variability in the contribution of As+IS infections, our analysis suggests that their contribution is unlikely to be less than 81% of their numerical prominence ( Fig 6).
